intro: Macleania insignis var. linearifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved macleania, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, acidic soils in shaded environments. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage.
